alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Calhoun, east central Mason, north central Kanawha, northeastern Putnam, Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 311 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Sandyville to 7 miles northeast of Kenna to 9 miles northeast of Buffalo. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Sissonville, Arnoldsburg, Kenna, Amma, Reedy, Leon, Millstone, Statts Mills, Harmony, Tariff, Given, Southside, Kentuck, Liberty, Walton, Left Hand, Orma, Grimms Landing and Looneyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 21 and 32. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 113 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
